messages.subject: Goofing Off??
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 9/7/01 5:06:30 PM US Mountain Standard Time, ... What is your son wants to become the best jazz drummer that ever lived?  What if you other
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 9/7/01 5:06:30 PM US Mountain Standard Time,
Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com writes:


> . My problem is if her
> brother chooses to practice his drums all day and her other brother builds
> Lego spaceships and movie scenes, they are goofing off and not learning
> anything. I disagree.
>

What is your son wants to become the best jazz drummer that ever lived? What
if you other son turns out to be the next George Lucas? Goofing off.... to
me what they are doing is unschooling. Sounds like your daughter has years
of indoctrination to work through... Why would she expect you to give her
work? Why doesn't she decide for herself what she wants to learn and go find
out about it?

Dawn

"The people who get on in this world
are people who get up and look for the
circumstances they want, and,
if they can't find them, make them." - George Bernard Shaw

"The only time my education was interrupted was when I was in school."-George
Bernard Shaw
